ovdesc.p: Encompassed within the Funds Transfer Module is a fully operational Inward Bulk Standing Orders application. In many respects it is similar to the Standing Order application, except of course it allows incoming payments to be bulked together for different debitors to one account, i.e. one credit, lots of debits.
This will allow the user to load standing orders as Fixed Payments with a known amount.

The application may be run on-line or as an end-of-day process. In order to run the Inward Bulk Standing Orders on-line, there is a separate application called SINGLE.INWARD.BULK. For more details refer to the relevant help text.
The FT.BULK.CREDIT file has the standard 3 versions:

This field determines the Debit value date calculation rules. It accepts relative or absolute dates.
You can combine 1 or 2 date operations, always based on the frequency date, each operation being "+" or "-", followed by a number of days and followed by "C" or "W", meaning calendar or working days.
"+" and "C" are taken by default.
If number alone entered then it will be converted into valid date.
If nothing is entered here, default calculation will be done through the Funds Transfer calculation rules, depending on the payment method.
Examples :
"+01C-01W" which means "Last working day before the processing date"
"-02C" means processing date less 2 calendar days,
"01" entered when the system month/ year is Jan/2001, then it will convert to 01012001
and so on ...

Up to 8 type ANY (alphanumeric) characters. "+" and "C" are optional, and zeros will be added if needed. Example : "1-1W" will be taken as "+01C-01W". Optional input, blank means default FT calculation.
Defaults the system date during BULK.STO Input.
Identifies any process errors or overrides that may have occurred on the individual payments.
If any errors or overrides are found on the main payment then, if the application is being run on-line, the User may input YES or NO to the override condition.
An input of NO will result in the Inward Bulk Standing Order going to the Exception file, in which case it will need to be authorised in order to execute it again.
An input of YES will override the condition and execution will carry on and build the Funds Transfer records.

However if any of the individual payments encounter any overrides the Funds Transfer records will be built as normal, except they will have a Record Status of 'IHLD'. The actual override condition will be held in this field.

Represents the ID by which each Inward Bulk Standing Order is uniquely identified.
The ID can be Account No followed by automatically generated sequence or Account no with date separated by "-" and a automatically generated sequence.
If the Id is given with a a date, then it will be consider as a Single Payment Type and the id date will be defaulted to single payment date and ID date has to be greater than today.
For a frequency based Bulk Standing order, the id has to be created with account no followed by automatically generated sequence number.
Hence for a same date using the sequence no, more than one Bulk Standing Orders can be created.
When the User wants to change an existing Inward Bulk Standing Order, it will be necessary to enter the complete reference number i.e. the Account Number and the date separated by a - (minus sign).

2-30 type A (alphanumeric) characters as follows: - The first part of the ID will identify the Account Number for which the User wants to define Inward Bulk Standing Order instructions( Input Mandatory). The format is the Standard numeric Account number or 3-10 character Account Mnemonic (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') - type MNE - The second part of the ID will be separated from the Account Number by a '-' and will be a date. (Optional input). The third part of ID is automatic generated sequence number given by the system.
If Date is entered as a part of ID, Id date defaulted as the Single payment date and ID date has to be greater than today.
For the Change function the User will need to enter the complete key including the date itself, as long as it is greater than or equal to today's.

Used to specify whether to move the Bulk.STO to history file (YES) or Not (NO) after the Status moves to "MAT".
If move to History is "No", such cases the Bulk STO record still will be available in live file even after "MAT" Status.
If we specify "Yes" or NULL , then as and when the Status moves to MAT, the Bulk STO record will be moved to History file.
For Bulk.STO which are frequency based only value "YES" or Null is allowed.
Valid value "Yes" or "No"

The Pay Method input in this field will be enriched with the Transaction Type 35 character description defined in the FT.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. The following Pay Method codes will be allowed:

p.strong: AC (or records with first 2 chars AC)

desc.p: An Inhouse transfer of funds, i.e. where no external payment is involved in the execution of the Bulk Standing Order instruction.

p.strong: IM (or records with first 2 chars IM)

desc.p: This Pay Method is used for external payments.
Mandatory input
Must be either AC, IM or records starting with AC or IM.

This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the description of the Inward Bulk Standing Order in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES) and will indicate to the User the Language in which the description must be entered.

IF Bulk STO fails during End of day operation and when a new BULK STO created, then new record will have the failed STO ID for reference in this field.
Updated by System.
For example

When STO ID 12345.1 failed during the execution and new record ID 12345.2 created by the system, then the STO ID 12345.2 will have 12345.1 in its related reference field to indicate that it got created using 12345.1 details.

If the Inward Bulk Standing Order is a 'PL' account, then the account input must not also be a 'PL' account.
Identifies the current frequency of the Bulk Standing Order for the total amount specified in TOTAL.CREDIT.AMOUNT.

The Bulk Standing Order application will execute the standing order instruction according to the frequency specified in this field up to and including the CURRENT.END.DATE specified in the next field.

This field is sub-divided into two elements: 1. Date 1-9 type D (date format in range 1950-2049) characters. 2. Frequency 1-5 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character alpha) characters. Mandatory input or not allowed as defined in
Validation Rules:.
No default.
Input mandatory if SINGLE.PAYMENT is set to 'NO'.
If SINGLE.PAYMENT is set to 'YES' then no input is allowed.
The date input will correspond to the first execution of the Bulk Standing Order.
The starting frequency must be greater than today.
An override will be required if the date input is a non-working day.
Defines whether the Bulk Standing Order is a one-off single payment or frequency associated.
If ID has a date, then the BULK STO has to be Single payment type and system defaults the single payment as YES" & single payment date as ID date.
Bulk STO's with Single payment type can also be created by giving the ID as account no & without date by giving single payment as "YES" and with single payment date.
Y(ES) The Bulk Standing Order is a single payment N(O) The Bulk Standing Order is frequency associated.
If the id has date, this field should be "YES" and single payment date has to be the ID date.
This field is reserved for future expansion.
